This app demonstrates:

1. All available parameters for `navset_bar`:
   - `title`: The navbar title
   - `id`: For tracking selected tab
   - `selected`: Default selected tab
   - `position`: Navbar position
   - `bg`: Background color
   - `inverse`: Text color scheme
   - `underline`: Active tab underline
   - `collapsible`: Mobile responsiveness
   - `fluid`: Layout type
   - `header`: Header content
   - `footer`: Footer content

2. Different types of nav elements:
   - Basic nav panel
   - Nav panel with icon
   - Nav menu (dropdown)
   - Nav control (custom content)
   - Nav spacer
   
3. Font Awesome icons included properly using `ui.head_content`

4. A simple reactive display of the selected tab value

The app is minimal and focused on demonstrating the navset_bar functionality without unnecessary additional components.

To run this app:

1. Save it as `app.py`
2. Make sure you have the required packages:
```bash
pip install shiny
```
3. Run with:
```bash
shiny run app.py
```

This will demonstrate a fully functional navigation bar with all possible features while keeping the implementation minimal.
